members.member:
Begin a session with QuickBooks for a given company file. The file may be opened, if it is not already open, in a given mode. The file must be fully specified; a partial file path will result in a failure to open the file. The mode is a request to open the file in a particular way. If the file is already open and the mode requested is not compatible, then an error is returned. Otherwise the file will be open in the requested mode.
@param qbFile a company file name, fully specified @param openMode requested mode (either RequestProcessor.SINGLE_USER, RequestProcessor.MULTI_USER, RequestProcessor.DONT_CARE) @return a ticket that must be used in subsequent calls

Closes a company file session and invalidates the ticket. This call is made after all processRequests calls have been completed. It results in the file being saved and closed. QuickBooks is not terminated.
@param ticket a ticket acquired in the beginSession call
Closes a QuickBooks connection. This call is always made after all work with QuickBooks is completed. It is important to make this call so QuickBooks will be closed properly.

Returns an error message associated with the last call. The error message is reset with each call that is made. This method may be called in order to help diagnose why a problem occurred.
@return the error message, may be null

Returns an error code associated with the last call. The error code is reset with each call that is made. This method must be called in order to determine whether the call was successful.
@return the error code, may be OK (0)

Begin a session with QuickBooks for a given company file. The file may be opened, if it is not already open, in a given mode. The file must be fully specified; a partial file path will result in a failure to open the file. The mode is a request to open the file in a particular way. If the file is already open and the mode requested is not compatible, then an error is returned. Otherwise the file will be open in the requested mode.
@param qbFile a company file name, fully specified @param openMode requested mode (either RequestProcessor.SINGLE_USER, RequestProcessor.MULTI_USER, RequestProcessor.DONT_CARE) @return a ticket that must be used in subsequent calls

Closes a company file session and invalidates the ticket. This call is made after all processRequests calls have been completed. It results in the file being saved and closed. QuickBooks is not terminated.
@param ticket a ticket acquired in the beginSession call
Closes a QuickBooks connection. This call is always made after all work with QuickBooks is completed. It is important to make this call so QuickBooks will be closed properly.

Returns an error message associated with the last call. The error message is reset with each call that is made. This method may be called in order to help diagnose why a problem occurred.
@return the error message, may be null

Returns an error code associated with the last call. The error code is reset with each call that is made. This method must be called in order to determine whether the call was successful.
@return the error code, may be OK (0)
